thread.title: No. 1 'Split' three-peats at box office with $14.6M
thread.title_full: No. 1 'Split' three-peats at box office with $14.6M

author: The Associated Press
title: No. 1 'Split' three-peats at box office with $14.6M
text:
No. 1 'Split' three-peats at box office with $14.6M M. Night Shyamalan's multiple personality thriller outpaced the latest 'Rings' movie. Post to Facebook No. 1 'Split' three-peats at box office with $14.6M M. Night Shyamalan's multiple personality thriller outpaced the latest 'Rings' movie.  //usat.ly/2kaCtLQ   No. 1 'Split' three-peats at box office with $14.6M Jake Coyle, The Associated Press 1:25 p.m. ET Feb. 5, 2017 CLOSE x Share He has 23 personalities and has shown them to his psychiatrist. But there is one he has yet to expose. Now, Kevin, played by James McAvoy, has kidnapped three teenage girls and their fate hangs in the balance as time is running out. USA TODAY NETWORK Anya Taylor-Joy (left) and James McAvoy (right) in M. Night Shyamalan's 'Split.' (Photo: John Baer, AP) 
NEW YORK â€” M. Night Shyamalan's multiple personality thriller Split led the box office for a third-straight week, a fairly unprecedented streak for a low-budget horror film. 
According to studio estimates Sunday, Split came out on top again with $14.6 million in North American ticket sales, bringing the release's three-week haul to $98.7 million. The film's run has come in an especially slow period at multiplexes. Hollywood traditionally bypasses Super Bowl weekend due to the game's enormous television audience. Spoilers: The secrets behind M. Night Shyamalan's surprise 'Split' ending 
The weekend's other horror option, Rings, came in second with an estimated $13 million. The sequel revived the dormant franchise begun with 2002's The Ring. 
The weekend's other debut, The Space Between Us, fizzled. The movie starring Asa Butterfield as a boy born on Mars made a mere $3.8 million. 
Final figures are expected Monday.
